did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University, Blacksburg, Va.
did.abstract: The collection contains papers of Los Angeles, California architect Lorraine Rudoff. Included are 2 rolls of floor plans and elevations from 1975-1976; one scrapbook containing photographs, clippings, architectural drawings, etc.; and three conference pins.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Permission to publish material from the Lorraine Rudoff Architectural Collection must be obtained from Special Collections, Virginia Tech.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: Lorraine Rudoff Architectural Collection, Ms1990-025 - Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University, Blacksburg, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The Lorraine Rudoff Architectural Collection was donated to Special Collections in 1990.

bioghist.head: Biographical Information
bioghist.p: Lorraine Rudoff was born in Bridgeport, CT in 1920 and began her education in New York City public schools before attending the Cooper Union School of Architecture. Initially, she attended an unknown school to study fashion design before attending Cooper Union, but discovered that the fashion industry wasn't favorable to women at the time and the pay was low.

Rudoff has over 35 years of varied architecture experience including commercial and industrial complexes, public schools, government projects, office and medical high-rise facilities, and high-rise apartment complexes. Some of her major projects include: serving as job caption on buildings for Lockheed and Hughes Aircraft and the Vons Market, meat processing plant in El Monte, CA.

A life member (1957-) of the Association for Women in Architecture (AWA) Rudoff has served as president, treasurer, program chair, as well as other offices. She was also active in The International Union of Women Architects (UIFA).
Always interested in arts and crafts Rudoff has taken classes at UCLA, Woodbury, and Barnsdall Arts and Craft Center. In her retirement she volunteered at the Craft and Folk Art Museum.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection contains: 1 roll of Architectural drawings totaling 33 sheets and dated 1976 of Vons Grocery Co. Meat Service Center in El Monte, CA; 1 roll of floor plans, elevations, color and furnishing schedule, etc. dated 1975 of the Economics Laboratory Inc. in Tucson, Az; 3 folders of scrapbook memorabilia containing photographs, architectural drawings, clippings, and certificates of achievements; and 1 envelope containing three conference pins (UIFA, AWA).

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged by material type.

descgrp.head: Related Material
descgrp.p: The ImageBase at Virginia Tech's Special Collections contains digital images of Rudoff's work.

did.unittitle: Envelope containing three conference pins (UIFA, AWA). Scrapbook memorabilia containing biography, photographs, clippings, and certificates of achievements.
Scrapbook memorabilia containing photographs, renderings, clippings, and photocopies.
2 architectural drawings containing plans and construction details for a house in Tucson, Arizona.
1 roll of architectural drawings totaling 33 sheets and dated 1976 of Vons Grocery Co. Meat Service Center in El Monte, CA.
1 roll of floor plans, elevations, color and furnishing schedule dated 1975 of the Economics Laboratory Inc. in Tucson, Az. Also, a photocopy of a personal note about the project.
